meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to 1760 yards.
meanings.sent1: The race was just a few lymes away from the finish line.
meanings.sent2: She walked for many lymes before reaching the store.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out to measure the room in lymes.
meanings.sent4: His patience was as long as a lymes when waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The road stretched out for what seemed like endless lymes.

meanings.definition: A unit of area equal to the area of a square with sides of one mile in length.
meanings.sent1: The field was so vast, it covered many lymes in every direction.
meanings.sent2: The map showed the entire city within a few lymes.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket was as big as a lymes in each direction.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination expanded to cover lymes of creative space.
meanings.sent5: The garden stretched out for lymes, filled with colorful flowers.

meanings.definition: A disease transmitted by ticks, characterized by fever and joint pain.
meanings.sent1: After the camping trip, he developed lymes and had to see a doctor.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was cautious to avoid ticks and prevent lymes.
meanings.sent3: The tick joked, 'I'm the bearer of lymes, not lime disease!'
meanings.sent4: The spread of rumors in the office was like lymes, causing discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The town was on high alert due to an outbreak of lymes.
